TEXT: The applicant is an NORP national , born in DATE and living in GPE . He is the father of PERSON .
He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
On DATE PERSON and her daughters PERSON and PERSON were killed in a terrorist bombing in GPE . The cars used for the bombing were stolen in GPE , GPE on DATE .

The NORP authorities conducted extensive inquiries but were unable to bring charges against any person . The files remain open . ORG ( ORG ) in GPE has conducted an inquiry into the theft of the vehicles and related offences which did not produce any results . However , there was no formal murder inquiry by the ORG .
On DATE ORG , a television station in GPE , broadcast a programme in which the adequacy of the ORG inquiry was discussed .

On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in ORG in GPE in order to force the NORP police to disclose information in its possession to the effect that GPE authorities had not fully co - operated with the NORP authorities in the murder inquiry . The applicant specified that this evidence would be used in the ORG proceedings .

On DATE ORG considered that this was not a case where it should exercise its inherent jurisdiction to order discovery . According to precedent , this jurisdiction would only be exercised in cases where the plaintiff had clear evidence of wrongdoing but did not know the identity of the wrongdoer which was known to the defendant .
The decision of ORG was upheld by ORG on DATE .
